moves.1. d4: This game is an exciting game all the way through which I played against mwgr. You never know which twist is going to take place next!
moves.1... Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 d5 4. c5: This move is typical me. I love pushing pawns into enemy territory...although this may be a bad idea after 4...b6 5.b4 a5 and 6.a3 is useless.
moves.4... b6 5. b4 a5 6. Qa4+: 6.a3 would lead to 6...axb4 and if 7.axb4 then Rxa1
moves.6... Bd7 7. b5: I push my pawns as far as possible!
moves.7... bxc5 8. Ba3 Na6 9. e3 Bd6 10. Nge2: Already an interesting battle is forming on the queenside.
moves.11. Bxd6 cxd6: I have created a passed pawn, exploiting my opponent's blocked pawn formation.
moves.12. Qc2 Nb4: I should have seen this. My opponent can win much material this way.
moves.13. Qd2 Nd3+ 14. Kd1 Nxf2+ 15. Ke1 Nxh1: At least my opponent's knight is trapped...
moves.16. g3 Ne4 17. Nxe4 dxe4 18. Rb1: I am backing up my passed pawn.
moves.18... Qf6 19. Nf4 e5 20. Nd5 Qd8 21. Bg2: My passed pawn is now well-defended...and I don't need to worry about my opponent's knight any more...
I am still trying to push this pawn
moves.30... Rd8 31. Kf1 Qd1+ 32. Qe1: I thought at this point that a queen exchange would improve my position.
An error on my opponent's part...I think...
Perhaps it would have been easier to promote the pawn if I hadn't allowed a queen exchange.
moves.41... Ke7 42. Kd2 Kd7 43. Kc3 h5 44. Kc4: I offered my opponent a draw, and he accepted. He was worried about my passed pawn, and I was worried about his material advantage and strong pawn formation.
